generif.text: Binding studies on recombinant human Siglec-9 show recognition of both Neu5Ac and Neu5Gc; in striking contrast, chimpanzee and gorilla Siglec-9 strongly prefer binding Neu5Gc.
Siglec-7 and Siglec-9 are capable of negative regulation of TCR signaling and ligand binding is required for optimal activity
Siglec-9 can inhibit Fc epsilon receptor I-mediated serotonin release from rat basophilic leukemia cells and recruit the tyrosine phosphatases SHP-1 and SHP-2.
data suggest that apoptotic (ROS- and caspase-dependent) and nonapoptotic (ROS-dependent) death pathways are initiated in neutrophils via Siglec-9
Siglecs-9 did not interact with sulfate derivatives of LacNAc and sulfated oligosaccharides containing sialic acid.
The Siglec-9 provides not only a useful marker for certain subsets of AML, but also a potential therapeutic target.
These results demonstrate that Siglec-9 enhances the production of the anti-inflammatory cytokine IL-10 in macrophages.
A review of the cytotoxic effects of natural anti-Siglec9 autoantibodies on both neutrophils and eosinophils.
Increased bacterial survival are also facilitated by group b Streptococcus sialylated capsular polysaccharide interactions with Siglec-9.
Septic shock patients exhibit different ex vivo death responses of blood neutrophils after Siglec-9 ligation early in shock.
Data suggest that age-specific interactions between Siglec-9 and SHP-1 may influence the altered inflammatory responsiveness and longevity of neonatal polymorphonuclear neutrophils.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
MUC16-Siglec-9 binding likely mediates inhibition of anti-tumor immune responses.
Siglec-9 A391C was the only polymorphism related to TCR-mediated signaling in human Siglec-9, resulting in less inhibition compared to the wild type.
These results suggest that Siglec-9 expressed on DCs is involved in immunoregulation through ligation with mucins in an epithelial cancer patient.
The Siglec-9 peptide binding to the enzymatic groove of VAP-1 can be used for imaging conditions, such as inflammation and cancer.

Siglec-9 expressed on immune cells may play a role as a potential counterreceptor for MUC1 and that this signaling may be another MUC1-mediated pathway and function in parallel with a growth factor-dependent pathway.

Protein degradation of focal adhesion kinase and related molecules was induced by Siglec-9 binding to its counterreceptors via sialylglycoconjugates, leading to the modulation of adhesion kinetics of cancer cells.

Expression of Siglec-7 and -9 ligands was associated with susceptibility of NK cell-sensitive tumor cells and, unexpectedly, of presumably NK cell-resistant tumor cells to NK cell-mediated cytotoxicity.
Dasatinib enhances migration of monocyte-derived dendritic cells by reducing phosphorylation of inhibitory immune receptors Siglec-9 and Siglec-3.
a polymorphism that reduced Siglec-9 binding to carcinomas was associated with improved early survival in non-small-cell lung cancer patients
Inflammation results in up-regulation of immuneinhibitory Siglec-8 and Siglec-9 sialoglycan ligands on human airways.
Ligands for Siglec-8 and Siglec-9 may regulate the function of eosinophils, mast cells, neutrophils, and other cells in sinus mucosa.
Constitutively expressed Siglec-9 inhibits LPS-induced CCR7, but enhances IL-4-induced CD200R expression in human macrophages.
This work defines a critical role for aberrantly glycosylated MUC1 and identifies an activating pathway that follows engagement of Siglec-9.

The SIGLEC9 rs2075803 G/rs2258983 A haplotype, which corresponds to a Siglec-9 variant that is less effective at suppressing inflammatory response, may be a risk factor for the development of emphysema.
The mechanism of the Siglec-9 and AOC3 interaction is mediated both by protein-sugar interactions via the V domain and by the protein-protein interactions via the C22 Siglec9 domain.
Data suggest that sialic acid-binding Ig-like lectin-9 (Siglec-9)may serve as a potential diagnostic and therapeutic target for rheumatoid arthritis (RA).

Glycophorin A, the most abundant sialoglycoprotein on erythrocytes, engaged neutrophil Siglec-9, a sialic acid-recognizing receptor known to dampen innate immune cell activation. These studies demonstrate a previously unsuspected role for erythrocytes in suppressing neutrophils ex vivo and in vitro and help explain why neutrophils become easily activated after separation from whole blood.
Siglec-9 expression is upregulated in chronic obstructive pulmonary disease.
These findings identify Siglec-9 as a negative regulator for NK cells contributing to HBV persistence and the intervention of Siglec-9 signaling might be of potentially translational significance.

Targeting of the sialoglycan-SAMP/Siglec pathway in vitro and in vivo resulted in increased anticancer immunity. T cell expression of Siglec-9 in NSCLC patients correlated with reduced survival, and Siglec-9 polymorphisms showed association with the risk of developing lung and colorectal cancer.

Expression of cognate Siglec-9 ligands was observed on the majority of tumor cells in primary and metastatic melanoma specimens. Targeting the tumor-restricted, glycosylation-dependent Siglec-9 axis may unleash this intratumoral T-cell subset, while confining T-cell activation to the tumor microenvironment.
SS erythrocytes are deficient in binding to neutrophil Siglec-9 which may contribute to the increased oxidative stress in SCD.
The Roles of Siglec7 and Siglec9 on Natural Killer Cells in Virus Infection and Tumour Progression.
Targeting glycosylated antigens on cancer cells using siglec-7/9-based CAR T-cells.
Modulation of immune cell reactivity with cis-binding Siglec agonists.
Identification and validation of a siglec-based and aging-related 9-gene signature for predicting prognosis in acute myeloid leukemia patients.
LINC01004-SPI1 axis-activated SIGLEC9 in tumor-associated macrophages induces radioresistance and the formation of immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment in esophageal squamous cell carcinoma.
Siglec-9 Restrains Antibody-Dependent Natural Killer Cell Cytotoxicity against SARS-CoV-2.
Siglec-9 acts as an immune-checkpoint molecule on macrophages in glioblastoma, restricting T-cell priming and immunotherapy response.
The change of Siglec-9 expression in peripheral blood NK cells of SFTS patients can affect the function of NK cells.
Expression of Siglec-9 in peripheral blood neutrophils was increased and associated with disease severity in patients with AECOPD.
The receptor binding domain of SARS-CoV-2 Omicron subvariants targets Siglec-9 to decrease its immunogenicity by preventing macrophage phagocytosis.

name: sialic acid binding Ig like lectin 9

kegg.name: Neutrophil extracellular trap formation - Homo sapiens (human)

reactome.name: Immunoregulatory interactions between a Lymphoid and a non-Lymphoid cell

summary: Predicted to enable monosaccharide binding activity and sialic acid binding activity. Predicted to be involved in cell adhesion. Predicted to act upstream of or within negative regulation of inflammatory response and negative regulation of phagocytosis, engulfment. Predicted to be located in external side of plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in plasma membrane. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
